positive.review: For a free MMO, this game really lands all the basics. Fun PvPvE chaos, lots of loot, and solid progression. It's a great place to ground yourself for some hack-and-slash action. Definitely worth claiming your spot in this Land!

NOTE: If you plan on playing this, please go to 'Guides' and follow the one to leave 'Beginner mode'. For some reason, there's a bug in beginner mode which makes it full PvP and drop items on death. The actual game is NOT LIKE THAT, and is a lot more forgiving.

This game is really, really good. I was a little hesitant as it has/had 'mixed' reviews but I gave it a go and immediately fell in love. It's very simple, but very deep. I'm at 40 hours (ish) at time of writing and feel like I've barely scratched the surface of the game.

If you like RotMG, Vampire Survivors or similar, this is absolutely for you. The graphics are super cute, the mechanics are really fun and the gameplay is really, really solid.

Im really really love this game but i dont like the pvp content of the and for some reason i just want to enjoy the pve content of the gameand i hope the game will have option to solo special boss because i dont have any people to play with or dont have enought

üåü"Hero's Land" A Fun but Flawed PVP Survival Experience That Demands Thick Skin!üåü

"Hero's Land" is a free-to-play 2D top-down survival MMO that blends PVE and PVP elements in a vibrant, open world. Developed by Orienjoy, the game tasks players with surviving against monsters and other players while upgrading gear, unlocking heroes, and forming guilds. With its charming pixel-art style and diverse gameplay modes‚Äîincluding dungeons, fishing, and boss raids‚Äîit offers initial excitement and depth . However, the experience is heavily marred by a toxic community, aggressive monetization, and a brutal environment for newcomers.

The core gameplay involves exploring maps, gathering resources, and battling monsters like shark-cats and sandworms to loot gear. Players can choose from heroes like the tanky Berserker or support-focused Bard, each with unique skills and weapon synergies . The combat is simple yet engaging, with mobility and dodging being key against bosses. Daily dungeons and events provide variety, while guild wars and battle royales cater to PVP enthusiasts . The game also features a player-driven economy where loot can be sold for currency .

Despite its strengths, "Hero's Land" suffers from critical flaws. The most glaring issue is the toxic PVP environment, where high-level players frequently camp safe zones and slaughter newcomers, leading to frustrating gear loss and wasted progress . The monetization model is aggressively pay-to-win, with expensive in-game purchases and imbalances between free and paying players . Additionally, the game lacks proper tutorials, forcing players to rely on external guides, and its repetitive grind can feel unrewarding without friends or a guild .

Pros:

üé® Charming Visuals: Bright, colorful pixel art and smooth animations .

‚öîÔ∏è Diverse Gameplay: PVE boss fights, dungeons, fishing, and PVP modes .

üõ†Ô∏è Deep Customization: Wide range of heroes, weapons, and gear sets with unique effects .

üë• Social Features: Guild support and multiplayer activities enhance teamwork .

üÜì Free to Play: Accessible with no upfront cost .

Cons:

üó£Ô∏è Toxic Community: Rampant griefing and bullying of new players .

üí∞ Pay-to-Win Mechanics: Strong monetization pressure for gear and heroes .

üìâ Steep Learning Curve: Lack of in-game guidance and overwhelming mechanics .

üîÅ Repetitive Grind: Tedious resource farming and unbalanced progression .

üåê Server Issues: Limited regional servers and language barriers (dominant Chinese player base) .


"Hero's Land" has potential with its engaging core loop and content variety, but it‚Äôs best suited for players who enjoy hardcore PVP and have a pre-made group to avoid its notorious community. Solo players and newcomers should approach with caution due to its predatory monetization and hostile environment. If you can overlook these flaws, it might provide some fun‚Äîbut for most, it‚Äôs a mixed bag that prioritizes whales over fairness.

For a free MMO, this game really lands all the basics. Fun PvPvE chaos, lots of loot, and solid progression. It's a great place to ground yourself for some hack-and-slash action. Definitely worth claiming your spot in this Land!

Solid, charming strategy game with a cool blend of town building and hero management. Combat is engaging, and there's a satisfying sense of progression as you expand your territory. Give one a try if you enjoy simple, but fun, strategy games!

The Game is Unexpectedly satisfying to play even as a free to play player, but if you are not going to spend money in the game is most likely a waste of time, you will reach that barrier soon that free to play player cannot beat it. Why? Because the only advantage the free to play player can have is by having friends to play with you, if you do not have real friends then don't bother trying play the game. the game mostly focus on events, new heroes and all things to add without actually trying to fix what matters most.

I've been playing the game with 80-1000ms everyday and for a game that has Asia server, I am lagging so much that I never experience in other games. The community here is mostly useless as all players mainly focus on themselves. Don't expect any help from anyone since getting help only happens 1/10.

I honestly feel that the game only cares about spenders and china community as you the game are filled with chinese and they never gets lag. The game also have some places that the language is chinese even though I use english as my main language. The game has its own translation but for some kind of reason, they can't translate the english to chinese so I still had to use google translate just to communicate with people who never really cares about helping.

I hope that the game adds benefits to those people who help so they will have some motivation to do so.
its good game i love it

My gambling addict friend said if I post a review and it gets 150 likes and 50 Awards that he will buy me a case of beer, some vodka and 1 kg of lemon So im just gonna leave this here.

"Hero's Land" has potential with its engaging core loop and content variety, but it‚Äôs best suited for players who enjoy hardcore PVP and have a pre-made group to avoid its notorious community. Solo players and newcomers should approach with caution due to its predatory monetization and hostile environment. If you can overlook these flaws, it might provide some fun‚Äîbut for most, it‚Äôs a mixed bag that prioritizes whales over fairness.

For a free MMO, this game really lands all the basics. Fun PvPvE chaos, lots of loot, and solid progression. It's a great place to ground yourself for some hack-and-slash action. Definitely worth claiming your spot in this Land!

üåü"Hero's Land" A Fun but Flawed PVP Survival Experience That Demands Thick Skin!üåü

"Hero's Land" is a free-to-play 2D top-down survival MMO that blends PVE and PVP elements in a vibrant, open world. Developed by Orienjoy, the game tasks players with surviving against monsters and other players while upgrading gear, unlocking heroes, and forming guilds. With its charming pixel-art style and diverse gameplay modes‚Äîincluding dungeons, fishing, and boss raids‚Äîit offers initial excitement and depth . However, the experience is heavily marred by a toxic community, aggressive monetization, and a brutal environment for newcomers.

The core gameplay involves exploring maps, gathering resources, and battling monsters like shark-cats and sandworms to loot gear. Players can choose from heroes like the tanky Berserker or support-focused Bard, each with unique skills and weapon synergies . The combat is simple yet engaging, with mobility and dodging being key against bosses. Daily dungeons and events provide variety, while guild wars and battle royales cater to PVP enthusiasts . The game also features a player-driven economy where loot can be sold for currency .

Despite its strengths, "Hero's Land" suffers from critical flaws. The most glaring issue is the toxic PVP environment, where high-level players frequently camp safe zones and slaughter newcomers, leading to frustrating gear loss and wasted progress . The monetization model is aggressively pay-to-win, with expensive in-game purchases and imbalances between free and paying players . Additionally, the game lacks proper tutorials, forcing players to rely on external guides, and its repetitive grind can feel unrewarding without friends or a guild .

After more than 700 hours of playing this game, I definitely not recommend this game to those who are small-hearted and only want to play this game to chill.

Player base are mostly trash, if you're a casual F2P player or a hardcore solo player and still want to try this game for the PVE aspect, good luck finding ppl who are willing to help your progress through the game. Imagine ALL of the non-dungeon end game bosses are located in the PVPVE area, which is totally trash and nonsense when you finally got someone to help you kill bosses or when you finally able to solo some end game bosses and start to farm them for the equipment drops,  there comes trash players who continuously trying to kill you on the spot, either they just messing around with you or they try to rob your drop.

Forget the PVP if you're a F2P, unless you got an already OP friend or P2W friend who are willing to help you get the OP PVP gears you need. F2P is totally fine if you are just going to enjoy the PVE aspect, everything is totally farmable here.

The game itself actually fun, BUT THE PLAYER BASE THEMSELVES ARE DESTROYING THE WHOLE GAME!!!

One of the most toxic environments I've ever witnessed. Also tried on mobile, and its the same. Essentially it's pay to win at its core. Every zone is PvP, you break items on death, so you don't use good stuff. People who are rich can afford to and will let you know how rich they are. I have been called poor, peasant, and everything you can think of as they hunt me for sport. No talking to them will help, they are dedicated to making you know they are rich, and this game lets them prove it. Cosmetics give stats, steeds give stats, artifacts give stats. Even in structured PvP with limited items, artifacts double or triple your stats. You will die in 1 hit and do no damage to these people. There is no competition and no hope. The game is designed to make you pay, and keep you paying or die. I have never felt so depressed in this type of game before, all hope is lost. The Devs make out they care, but it's simply a way to earn quick money from the rich before the game dies, and it is dying on pc and mobile. Entire servers are empty, entire zones are dead, sometimes you wait 20 minutes for another person to play with. Other than that, it's people hunting you and not playing the game. The game to them is killing all poor people and show off with emotes and steeds.

Forget the PVP if you're a F2P, unless you got an already OP friend or P2W friend who are willing to help you get the OP PVP gears you need. F2P is totally fine if you are just going to enjoy the PVE aspect, everything is totally farmable here.

The game itself actually fun, BUT THE PLAYER BASE THEMSELVES ARE DESTROYING THE WHOLE GAME!!!

One of the most toxic environments I've ever witnessed. Also tried on mobile, and its the same. Essentially it's pay to win at its core. Every zone is PvP, you break items on death, so you don't use good stuff. People who are rich can afford to and will let you know how rich they are. I have been called poor, peasant, and everything you can think of as they hunt me for sport. No talking to them will help, they are dedicated to making you know they are rich, and this game lets them prove it. Cosmetics give stats, steeds give stats, artifacts give stats. Even in structured PvP with limited items, artifacts double or triple your stats. You will die in 1 hit and do no damage to these people. There is no competition and no hope. The game is designed to make you pay, and keep you paying or die. I have never felt so depressed in this type of game before, all hope is lost. The Devs make out they care, but it's simply a way to earn quick money from the rich before the game dies, and it is dying on pc and mobile. Entire servers are empty, entire zones are dead, sometimes you wait 20 minutes for another person to play with. Other than that, it's people hunting you and not playing the game. The game to them is killing all poor people and show off with emotes and steeds.
classic p2w gacha game with dead playerbase, gets boring after a while
as you can i see a gave it a chance, really not very balenced and absalutly PAIN FULL for ftp players

Its a fun game if your into gridning. thought it has some very stupid weird ticks that could have fixed so far and I hope that they will fix it in the future. Like for example, why on Gods green planet Earth does the players charachter have a limited amount of attack stamina but the monsters and enmies can attack you for however long they need until they kill your charachter. Not only that there is no ability to doge attacks what so ever. So if your faced with a monster that is able to attack in mulptile areas at once or a fast monster, the only way you can avoid there attack is to run around for your dear life until the mosnter moves too far from there spawn point, so they leave you alone. It is not fair, its very player gameplay sobtaging for no reason what so ever. I never in my life seen a combat grind game with no dodge ability lmfao like bro what??????? 

other than that like I mentioned its a simple fun cute charachters with abilities and powers and you grind to get stronger. Simple and actually somewhat fun. It just sucks how low your stamina is and how there is no dodge ablity waht so ever.
